Serialized Form

  • Package &lt;Unnamed&gt;

    • Class Game extends java.awt.Frame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • eatButton

          Buttons eatButton
          Buttons that will be used to handle the "eat" action, exiting, and the zone within which the hippo can "eat." A Buttons was used for this as it had a very effective isInside() method.

        • exitButton

          Buttons exitButton
          Buttons that will be used to handle the "eat" action, exiting, and the zone within which the hippo can "eat." A Buttons was used for this as it had a very effective isInside() method.

        • eatZone

          Buttons eatZone
          Buttons that will be used to handle the "eat" action, exiting, and the zone within which the hippo can "eat." A Buttons was used for this as it had a very effective isInside() method.

        • x

          int x
          Two integer values to hold x and y values of the mouse location

        • y

          int y
          Two integer values to hold x and y values of the mouse location

        • player

          Hippo player
          New Hippo object player is the player's hippo

        • pellets

          Pellet[] pellets
          New Pellet array of length 10 to hold UpScore and DownScore pellets that will appear randomly around the window.

        • pelletX

          int pelletX
          Integer values to hold the x and y locations of the pellets in the array, as well as an isGood integer to determine whether or not to generate an UpScore or DownScore pellet based on random generation.

        • pelletY

          int pelletY
          Integer values to hold the x and y locations of the pellets in the array, as well as an isGood integer to determine whether or not to generate an UpScore or DownScore pellet based on random generation.

        • isGood

          int isGood
          Integer values to hold the x and y locations of the pellets in the array, as well as an isGood integer to determine whether or not to generate an UpScore or DownScore pellet based on random generation.

        • r

          java.util.Random r
          New Random generator to generate random x and y locations for the Pellet objects as well as determine whether or not to generate UpScore or DownScore pellets

        • timer

          int timer
          Integer value timer used to determine how long a round lasts.

        • score

          Score score
          New Score object to hold the score value

        • background

          java.awt.Image background
          New Image object to serve as the background of the game

        • eat

          java.awt.Image eat
          New Image object to serve as the "eat" button

        • BUTTON_WIDTH

          int BUTTON_WIDTH
          Constant to pertain to the default width of a button

        • BUTTON_HEIGHT

          int BUTTON_HEIGHT
          Constant to pertain to the default height of a button

        • DELAY

          long DELAY
          Constant to control the delay between valid clicks of the "eat" button. Greater values decrease the frequency at which the "eat" button can be pressed and have the actions performed.

        • recentClick

          long recentClick
          long variable to represent the last time a valid click of the "eat" button has been pressed
